subject: Philosophy
title: The Principle of Charity
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Principle of Charity.

hook.text: When someone makes a bad argument, do you attack the weakest version â€” or steel-man the strongest?

buildup.text: The principle of charity says: interpret an opponent's argument in its strongest possible form before responding.

discovery.text: This forces you to engage with the best ideas, not cheap caricatures. It makes your own thinking sharper.

twist.text: Social media does the opposite: people attack the weakest version of views they disagree with. That's a straw man.

climax.text: Charitable interpretation leads to better debates, deeper understanding, and occasionally changed minds.

punchline.text: Defeat the best version of an argument, not the worst.

quiz.question: What does the principle of charity require?
options: Interpreting arguments in their strongest possible form
